âœ¨ DeArrow | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Improving the accuracy and reducing the sensationalism of YouTube video titles and thumbnails through a crowdsourced system.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Crowdsourced titles and thumbnails for YouTube videos â€¢ User voting system for submitted titles and thumbnails â€¢ Configurable fallback options for titles and thumbnails â€¢ Option to format titles to user preference (e.g., sentence case)
ðŸ“– Summary: DeArrow is a browser extension that aims to combat sensationalism and inaccuracy in YouTube titles and thumbnails. It allows users to crowdsource and vote on better, more accurate titles and thumbnails, providing a cleaner and more informative viewing experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ WhisperKitAndroid | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling offline, on-device automatic speech recognition for Android applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ On-device speech recognition â€¢ Support for Android and Linux â€¢ Extends WhisperKit functionality â€¢ Experimental API with opt-in â€¢ Integration with QNN for hardware acceleration
ðŸ“– Summary: WhisperKit Android brings on-device speech recognition capabilities to Android and Linux platforms, extending the functionality of the original WhisperKit from Apple devices. It allows for the transcription of audio directly on the device, offering a subset of features from its iOS counterpart with ongoing development and community contributions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ homepage-lite | CSS
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a centralized, visually appealing, and easy-to-manage dashboard for home lab services, bookmarks, and system monitoring.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Service Monitoring (real-time status checks, visual indicators) â€¢ Bookmark Management (organized by groups, custom abbreviations) â€¢ System Metrics (CPU, memory, disk usage with real-time updates) â€¢ Modern UI (responsive, multiple themes, custom backgrounds, Iconify integration) â€¢ Lightweight Design (single binary, low memory footprint)
ðŸ“– Summary: Homepage-lite is a lightweight, Go-powered dashboard designed for managing and monitoring homelab services and bookmarks. It offers real-time status checks, system metrics, and a customizable modern UI with multiple themes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ stremio-web | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To serve as a unified, user-friendly interface for discovering and consuming video content from multiple sources via add-ons.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Discover, watch, and organize video content â€¢ Utilizes easy-to-install add-ons for content integration â€¢ Modern media center interface â€¢ Built with JavaScript â€¢ Development and production build scripts
ðŸ“– Summary: Stremio-web is a modern media center application built with JavaScript that allows users to discover, watch, and organize video content through easily installable add-ons. It provides a unified interface for accessing and managing various video sources.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ audacity | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Editing and recording audio on a personal computer.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-track audio editing â€¢ Audio recording â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux) â€¢ Open-source (GPLv3 license)
ðŸ“– Summary: Audacity is a free, open-source, cross-platform audio editor and recorder. It supports multi-track editing and is available for Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux, and other operating systems.
